workflow.name: Automated Stripe dispute alert & case tracking with Slack + ClickUp
workflow.description:
## Description:
Stay ahead of payment disputes with this automated n8n workflow that integrates Stripe, Slack, and ClickUp. Perfect for finance teams, payment ops specialists, and SaaS businesses, this template fetches disputes directly from Stripe, analyzes urgency, and instantly notifies your team with rich, formatted alerts.

High-priority disputes are flagged, pushed into Slack for immediate visibility, and tracked in ClickUp with due dates aligned to Stripe evidence deadlines‚Äîensuring no dispute ever slips through the cracks. For lower-priority or resolved cases, the workflow provides concise updates and maintains an audit trail.

No more manual Stripe checks, late responses, or missed deadlines‚Äîthis workflow turns dispute management into a proactive, structured process.

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step):
 üü¢ Trigger: Manual or Scheduled Execution
 Run the workflow on demand or schedule it (e.g., every 4 hours).

üì• Fetch Stripe Disputes
 Calls the Stripe API to retrieve all active disputes in your account.

üìä Validate & Format Data
 Ensures disputes exist, then enriches data with formatted amounts, deadlines, and customer info.

‚öñÔ∏è Priority Logic
 Determines urgency based on dispute status, evidence deadlines, and transaction amount.

üö® High Priority Path
 ‚Ä¢ Sends urgent Slack alert with full dispute details
 ‚Ä¢ Creates a high-priority ClickUp task with due dates
 ‚Ä¢ Flags immediate action required

üìã Standard Path
 ‚Ä¢ Sends standard Slack alert for non-urgent cases
 ‚Ä¢ Creates a ClickUp task with appropriate priority levels

‚ÑπÔ∏è No Disputes Path
 Sends a Slack summary confirming no new disputes, maintaining a clear audit trail.

‚úÖ Workflow Completion
 Confirms all disputes are processed, logged, and assigned‚Äîready for your team to take action.

## Required Integrations:
‚úÖ Stripe API (for dispute data)
‚úÖ Slack API (for team alerts)
‚úÖ ClickUp API (for task management)

## Perfect For:
 üí≥ FinOps and payment operations teams monitoring transactions
 üè¢ SaaS platforms or e-commerce handling large payment volumes
 üõ°Ô∏è Risk and compliance teams tracking disputes and deadlines
 üìà Businesses scaling customer payment handling and case management

## Why Use This Template?
 ‚úîÔ∏è Never miss a dispute deadline
 ‚úîÔ∏è Automated priority assessment saves hours of manual checks
 ‚úîÔ∏è Seamlessly integrates alerts + task tracking
 ‚úîÔ∏è Provides full visibility and accountability for dispute resolution

parameters.content:
## üîÑ WORKFLOW START

**Purpose:** This workflow automatically monitors Stripe for payment disputes and creates alerts + tasks when disputes are found.

**Trigger:** Manual execution (can be scheduled)

**Next Step:** Fetch disputes from Stripe API

nodes.name: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Fetch Stripe Disputes
nodes.notes: Retrieves all current payment disputes from your Stripe account. This includes disputes that customers have filed against payments.

parameters.content:
## üîç DATA VALIDATION

**Purpose:** Checks if any disputes were found in the API response.

**Logic:**
- ‚úÖ TRUE: Disputes exist ‚Üí Process them
- ‚ùå FALSE: No disputes ‚Üí Send summary notification

**Why Important:** Prevents errors when no disputes exist

nodes.name: 2Ô∏è‚É£ Validate Disputes Data
nodes.notes: Checks if the Stripe API returned any disputes. If no disputes exist, workflow will notify and end gracefully.

parameters.content:
## ‚ö° PRIORITY ASSESSMENT

**Purpose:** Determines if disputes need immediate attention.

**High Priority Criteria:**
- Status = 'needs_response'
- Evidence deadline approaching
- Large dispute amounts

**Result:** Different notification types based on urgency

nodes.name: 3Ô∏è‚É£ Determine Priority Level
nodes.notes: Analyzes dispute urgency. High priority disputes (needs_response status) get immediate alerts, others get standard notifications.

parameters.content:
## üö® HIGH PRIORITY PATH

**Triggers When:** 
- Dispute status = 'needs_response'
- Immediate action required

**Actions:**
1. Send urgent Slack alert with full details
2. Create high-priority ClickUp task
3. Set due date to evidence deadline

nodes.name: 4aÔ∏è‚É£ Send Urgent Slack Alert
nodes.notes: Sends immediate alert to Slack with comprehensive dispute information. Formatted for high visibility and quick action.

nodes.name: 5aÔ∏è‚É£ Create Urgent ClickUp Task
nodes.notes: Creates high-priority task in ClickUp with detailed action plan and evidence deadline as due date.

parameters.content:
## üìã REGULAR PRIORITY PATH

**Triggers When:** 
- Standard dispute notifications
- Non-urgent status

**Actions:**
1. Send standard Slack notification
2. Create normal-priority ClickUp task
3. Track for regular follow-up

nodes.name: 4bÔ∏è‚É£ Send Standard Slack Alert
nodes.notes: Sends standard dispute notification to Slack for non-urgent cases. Contains essential information for tracking.

nodes.name: 5bÔ∏è‚É£ Create Standard ClickUp Task
nodes.notes: Creates standard priority task in ClickUp with appropriate priority level and comprehensive details.

parameters.content:
## ‚ÑπÔ∏è NO DISPUTES FOUND

**Purpose:** Handles the case when no disputes are returned from Stripe.

**Action:** 
- Sends informational message
- Confirms workflow ran successfully
- Provides timestamp for logging

**Why Useful:** Confirms monitoring is working

nodes.name: 6Ô∏è‚É£ Send Status Summary
nodes.notes: Sends confirmation message when no disputes need processing. Provides audit trail of workflow execution.

parameters.content:
## üöÄ AUTOMATION SETUP

**How to Use:**
1. Set up Stripe API credentials
2. Configure Slack workspace & channels  
3. Connect ClickUp workspace
4. Test with manual trigger
5. Set up schedule (recommended: every 4 hours)

**Requirements:**
- Stripe API access
- Slack bot permissions
- ClickUp API token

## üîÑ WORKFLOW COMPLETION

**What Happens:**
- Disputes are processed and tracked
- Team is notified via Slack
- Tasks created in ClickUp
- Evidence deadlines set

**Next Steps:**
1. Review Slack notifications
2. Check ClickUp tasks
3. Respond to disputes in Stripe
4. Monitor deadlines

nodes.name: üîß Format Dispute Data
nodes.notes: Transforms raw Stripe data into user-friendly format. Calculates priority, formats amounts, and prepares data for notifications.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
